_header: Ever in one with my due attendance

CULFf16.First Lines:
Euer yn one with my dew attendaunceto serue you aboue any
                    creatureWith owten remembraunce of heuy varyaunceSchall be my ioye
                    whylys þat my lyf maye dure…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…My nowne dyre herte yn my fful affyaunceAboue all oþer
                    formidd by nature
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
CULFf16.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 156.
